paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper reports a heterozygous mutation c.307G>C (p.G83R) in the TTR gene associated with hereditary vitreous amyloidosis in three Han Chinese families, detailing penetrance data and individual cases.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The proband (III:20) is a 34-year-old man who had had vision failure for 1 year.

individual_records.phenotype_details: vision problems in both eyes, underwent operation
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The proband (III:21) of Family B is a 50-year-old woman who suffered vision problem in both eyes 5 years before.
The proband (III:7) of Family C is a 59-year-old man who had vision loss at the age of 40.

Though some patients in the three families, such as II:7 in Family A and the probands in Family B (III:21) and Family C (III:7), were older, they did not express any abnormality in other organs/tissues.
excluding individuals III:27 and IV:20 in Family B who had no ophthalmological or other symptoms but had mutation c.307G>C
excluding individuals III:27 and IV:20 in Family B who had no ophthalmological or other symptoms but had mutation c.307G>C

functional_data.summary: The mutation p.G83R changes a highly conserved glycine to arginine in position 83 of the TTR protein, altering its tertiary structure.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregates with disease in the families.
variants.population_frequency: Not present in 196 unrelated healthy controls.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on segregation and clinical correlation.
variants.additional_notes: The mutation was not found in unrelated healthy controls, indicating its potential pathogenic role.
key_quotes: Mutation p.G83R in the TTR protein is associated with HVA in Chinese families.
This mutation changed the highly conserved glycine to arginine in the 83rd position and altered the tertiary structure of the TTR protein.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
